definition: to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to flash through (one's mind)/to dodge (away from pursuers)

sentences.english: It was then I noticed tears glistening on my mother's cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 恰在此时，我看到妈妈的面颊上闪着晶莹的泪光。

sentences.english: When we was walking on the beach, we saw many sea-shells.
sentences.chinese: 当我闪在海滩上散步时，我们看到我许多贝壳。

sentences.english: Catching each other's eyes glinting in the night, they held their cane knives and machetes with tight fists.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的眼里都闪着光芒，双拳紧握甘蔗刀和大刀。

sentences.english: Master the manipulation of flash-fire cupping therapy.
sentences.chinese: 掌握闪火法拔罐的操作。

sentences.english: Her hair shone copper in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发在阳光下闪着紫铜色。

sentences.english: With a flash, the kerosene lamp went out.
With a flash, the kerosene lamp went out.
It was like a slap in the face - a wake up call.
sentences.chinese: 它就像是在我脸上闪了一巴掌似的唤醒了我。

sentences.english: The famous film eventually made its way to our nabe.
sentences.chinese: 我闪社区最终放映了这部著名影片。

sentences.english: Unto Shem also, the father of all the children of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder, even to him were children born.
sentences.chinese: 雅弗的哥哥闪，是希伯子孙之祖，他也生了儿子。

sentences.english: Meeting in danger?Foreign guy Mou simply straining Shan didn't question this answer.
sentences.chinese: 会有危险么？外国佬眸光闪了闪，没有回答这个问题。

sentences.english: Meeting in danger?Foreign guy Mou simply straining Shan didn't question this answer.
sentences.chinese: 会有危险么？外国佬眸光闪了闪，没有回答这个问题。

sentences.english: He sends lightning with the rain and brings out the wind from his storehouses.
sentences.chinese: 他造电随雨而闪，从他府库中带出风来。

sentences.english: By( such powerful preposition) her deep inhale, the little firelight got flickering.
sentences.chinese: 深吸着，让那小火光闪了闪。

sentences.english: By( such powerful preposition) her deep inhale, the little firelight got flickering.
sentences.chinese: 深吸着，让那小火光闪了闪。

sentences.english: Where the rivers run clear and the bracken is gold in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 这里，溪流清澈明净，水草在阳光下闪着金色的波光。

definition: to dazzle/to blink at/to open one's eyes wide
light/beam of light/gleam of light/light reflected from an object
to get out of the way
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
to jump out of the way
